# objective
objective = "Block access to social media on my Mac while I'm working using Cold Turkey."

# past actions
def solve():
	# sub-task 1: Download Cold Turkey Basic for macOS
	# step 1: Navigate to Cold Turkey website
	goto(url="https://getcoldturkey.com")
	# step 2: Click on the Download Now button
	click(element_id="1527")
	# step 3: Click on Download for macOS in the Basic version section
	click(element_id="4257")
	# sub-task 2: Install Cold Turkey on macOS
	# step 4: Locate and click on the downloaded installer file
	# Assuming the file automatically appears at the bottom of the browser as per the instructions
	click(element_id="8009")
	# step 5: Begin the installation process
	click(element_id="8744")
	# step 6: Choose to install the app for all users on the computer
	click(element_id="9514")
	# step 7: Confirm installation
	click(element_id="4708")
	# step 8: Enter the password for the Mac user account
	type(element="Password", content="useraccount_password")
	# step 9: Finish the installation
	click(element_id="5099")
	# sub-task 3: Locate and open Cold Turkey Blocker application
	# step 10: Search for Cold Turkey using Spotlight
	type(element="Spotlight", content="Cold Turkey")
	# step 11: Open Cold Turkey Blocker.app from the search results
	click(element_id="4467")
response:
# sub-task 4: Install browser extensions for the web browsers you use
# step 12: Past actions indicate successful navigation and downloading of the Cold Turkey software, followed by installation on a macOS system. The Cold Turkey Blocker application was found and opened, which suggests setup progression.

Perform the next action—click the "Install" button beside the Chrome browser extension—to ensure Cold Turkey can block websites directly within Chrome, thus finalizing the blocking capabilities across applications and browsers.
click(element_id="93")
# step summary: Install the extension for Chrome by clicking Install next to it

# objective
objective = "Make the "Annual Report" Google Doc available to anyone with the link, allowing them to comment."

# past actions
def solve():
	# sub-task 1: Find the document you are interested in
	# step 1: Hover over the "3 vertical dots" menu of a document labeled "Annual Report".
	hover(element_id="2973")
	# step 2: Click the "3 vertical dots" button next to the "Annual Report" file to view more options.
	click(element_id="3769")
	# sub-task 2: Access sharing settings
	# step 3: Click the "Share" button in the menu.
	click(element_id="4876")
	# step 4: Click on the "Not shared" icon to change sharing settings.
	click(element_id="9017")
	# sub-task 3: Modify who can access the file
	# step 5: Click "Change" to modify access levels.
	click(element_id="4284")
	# step 6: Click the arrow next to "Restricted" to expand the options.
	click(element_id="1849")
	# step 7: Click on "Anyone with the link" to allow anyone with the link to access the file.
	click(element_id="8076")
	# sub-task 4: Adjust permissions for viewers
	# step 8: Click on the "Viewer" drop-down menu to select the permission level.
	click(element_id="3112")
	# step 9: Choose "Commenter" to let people with the link comment on the "Annual Report" document.
	click(element_id="3223")
	# sub-task 5: Finalize and obtain the link for sharing
	# step 10: Tap the back arrow to head back to the main menu of sharing options.
	click(element_id="8829")
response:
# step 11: After navigating through the document's settings and adjusting the sharing preferences, the sharing setup has been modified to allow anyone with the link to comment on the "Annual Report". The next step is to copy the shareable link to distribute it to the intended recipients. Click the "Copy link" button to achieve this.
click(element_id="40")
# step summary: Tap the "Copy link" button to copy the link for distribution.
